text_en:
A stray miracle unfolded this morning: a blind cat regained sight and led its owner to a lost wedding ring buried under a paving stone in Soho. Heaven denies the act. Hell calls it "disappointingly poetic."

On your desk, there is a cup of cocoa. Still warm. You don't remember ordering it.
text_zh:
今晨，一只失明的猫忽然重获视力，引导主人在苏豪区的一块铺路石下找回了遗失多年的婚戒。天堂否认与此有关，地狱称其“浪漫得令人作呕”。

你的办公桌上多了一杯可可，还是温热的，你不记得点过它。

choices.label_en: File a miracle report to Heaven (and watch them pretend to care)
choices.label_zh: 向天堂提交奇迹报告（然后看他们假装在乎）
choices.consequence_zh: 天堂奇迹管理部发来一份礼貌的确认函，迟到了三周，地址写错了部门，还盖着“无需进一步处理”的印章。那只猫后来被追封为一位小圣徒。
choices.consequence_en: Heaven’s Miracles Division sent a polite acknowledgment. It arrived three weeks late, addressed to the wrong department, and stamped ‘NO FURTHER ACTION REQUIRED.’ The cat has since been promoted to a minor saint.

choices.label_en: Ignore it — a cat finding a ring isn't the end of the world
choices.label_zh: 不处理——不过一只猫找到一枚戒指，又不是世界末日
choices.consequence_zh: 猫主人把故事发到了Reddit上。十二个赞和一条评论：“假的。”
choices.consequence_en: The cat’s owner posted the story on Reddit. Twelve upvotes and one comment: ‘fake.’

choices.label_en: Seal the archive and personally confiscate the ring
choices.label_zh: 封存档案并亲自没收那枚戒指
choices.consequence_zh: 戒指放在第七号档案库里，夹在一瓶1782年的喷嚏和一只会指向北方的指南针之间。天堂提交了一份嘉奖令，你收获了一份头痛。
choices.consequence_en: The ring now sits in Archive Vault 7, between a bottled sneeze from 1782 and a compass that only points to regret. Heaven filed a commendation. You filed a headache.

text_en:
A celestial choir accidentally performed a new harmony — one not listed in the Divine Archives. The sound caused spontaneous weeping in three parliamentarians and a rain of frogs in North London.

Heaven calls it a "beautiful mishap." Hell remains suspiciously silent.

You realize: if you record this hymn, it becomes real. If you don't, it might happen again.
text_zh:
天界唱诗班无意中演奏了一段未被登记的全新和声，导致三位议员自发痛哭，北伦敦则下起了青蛙雨。

天界称之为“美丽的失误”，地狱异常沉默。

你意识到：如果你记录这首圣歌，它就变成了事实。如果不记录，它可能会再次发生。

choices.label_en: Archive the hymn note-by-note — someone has to keep score
choices.label_zh: 逐个音符留存下档案——总得有人记谱
choices.consequence_zh: 这首圣歌正式编入天界乐谱目录，编号6,020,207。那三位议员还是会听到升C调就流泪。至于青蛙雨，没人给出过解释。
choices.consequence_en: The hymn is now officially catalogued as Celestial Composition #6,020,207. The three parliamentarians still cry whenever they hear a C-sharp. Nobody has explained the frogs.

choices.label_en: File it as atmospheric interference (frogs happen)
choices.label_zh: 归类为大气干扰（青蛙嘛，常有的事）
choices.consequence_zh: 青蛙和哭声都消失了，北伦敦恢复日常。你的报告被归入“天气：异常但无需处置”类目。
choices.consequence_en: The frogs dispersed. The weeping stopped. North London returned to its usual state of mild, secular disappointment. Your report was filed under ‘Weather: Unusual but Non-Actionable.’

choices.label_en: Teach the harmony to a street musician and see what unfolds
choices.label_zh: 把和声教给一个街头艺人，看看会发生什么
choices.consequence_zh: 那个街头艺人在国王十字车站外演奏了这段和声。两只鸽子当场爆炸，一位女士的咖啡变成了红酒。他收获了47.5英鎊的打赏，以及天堂和地狱分别发来的一份正式警告。
choices.consequence_en: The busker played the harmony outside King’s Cross. Two pigeons exploded. A woman’s coffee turned to wine. He earned £47.50 in tips and a formal warning from both Heaven and Hell.

text_en:
An ancient demonic sigil has appeared in a school restroom in Hackney. The student who drew it insists it's a streetwear logo he saw on Instagram. It's now trending on TikTok with 2.3 million views. Local clergy are in full panic.

The sigil, you note, is misspelled. Which somehow makes it worse.
text_zh:
哈克尼区一所学校的洗手间墙上出现了古老的地狱符印。画它的学生坚称那是他在Instagram上看到的潮牌logo，相关帖子已在TikTok上获得230万播放量，本地牧师集体陷入恐慌。

你注意到，符印拼写有误。但不知怎的，这反而让事情更糟了。

choices.label_en: Send angels to fight a bathroom wall (this is your job now)
choices.label_zh: 派天使去跟一面厕所墙较劲（这就是你的工作）
choices.consequence_zh: 两位六翼天使花了四十分钟净化一面瓷砖墙，他们拒绝在事后报告中提及此事。那个学生被罚了禁闭，同时收到一份来历不明的奖学金通知。
choices.consequence_en: Two seraphim spent forty minutes purifying a tile wall. They refused to mention it in their after-action report. The student received a detention and a mysterious scholarship offer.

choices.label_en: Rebrand it as conceptual art — nobody questions art
choices.label_zh: 重新包装成观念艺术——没人会质疑艺术
choices.consequence_zh: 一周后，这个符印出现在泰特现代美术馆的展览邀请函上，策展人称之为“后讽刺超验主义”。三个恶魔参加了开幕夜，他们觉得自己被人类理解了。
choices.consequence_en: A week later, the sigil appeared on an invitation to Tate Modern. The curator called it ‘post-ironic transcendentalism.’ Three demons attended the opening night. They felt seen.

choices.label_en: Silence the reporters, wipe the footage, pretend it's Tuesday
choices.label_zh: 封口记者，抹除视频，假装今天是个普通的星期二
choices.consequence_zh: 视频消失了，记者们也都忘记了。符印还在那里，有人在上面贴了张写着“故障中”的贴纸。
choices.consequence_en: The footage vanished. The reporters forgot. The sigil is still there — someone covered it with a sticker that reads ‘OUT OF ORDER.’

text_en:
A vicar in Tadfield delivered a sermon declaring that both angels and demons "probably mean well, in their own way." He's now being denounced by Heaven, mocked by Hell, and trending on Twitter as #SwitzerlandVicar.

He also mentioned, quite casually, that someone leaves a cup of cocoa on the church steps every Sunday. "I never see who," he said. "But it's always the right temperature."
text_zh:
塔德菲尔德的一位牧师在布道中称，“天使与恶魔可能都各自有苦衷。”天界谴责他，地狱嘲笑他，而他正因 #瑞士牧师 标签在推特上爆红。

他还随口提到，每个周日都有人在教堂台阶上放一杯可可。“我从没看见是谁，”他说，“但温度总是刚好。”

choices.label_en: Have Heaven issue a formal correction (they love those)
choices.label_zh: 让天堂发一份正式勘误声明（他们最爱这个）
choices.consequence_zh: 天堂的勘误声明长达十四页，用了一种没人看得懂的字体。牧师把它钉在教堂布告栏上，紧挨着一份柠檬糖霜蛋糕的食谱。教堂出席率翻了一倍。
choices.consequence_en: Heaven’s correction ran to 14 pages in a font nobody could read. The vicar pinned it to the church noticeboard next to a recipe for lemon drizzle cake. Attendance doubled.

choices.label_en: Let Hell turn his neutrality into a recruitment pitch
choices.label_zh: 让地狱把他的中立立场变成招募广告
choices.consequence_zh: 地狱的招募手册把牧师的话断章取义地引用了，效果好得令人不安。
choices.consequence_en: Hell’s recruitment pamphlet quoted the vicar entirely out of context. It worked disturbingly well.

choices.label_en: Protect him — humans are allowed to be confused
choices.label_zh: 保护他——人类有权感到困惑
choices.consequence_zh: 牧师继续布道。周日，可可照常出现在教堂台阶上。
choices.consequence_en: The vicar continued his sermons. On Sunday, the cup of cocoa appeared on the church steps as usual. This time, there were two.

text_en:
An angel assigned to oversee traffic flow in central London has vanished. Heaven insists he's "on a deep meditative retreat." Hell can barely contain its laughter. Humans, meanwhile, remain stuck in a gridlock stretching from Marble Arch to Tower Bridge.

You suspect he simply wandered into a bookshop and forgot to leave.
text_zh:
一位负责管理伦敦市中心交通的天使失踪了。天界坚称他正在“深度冥想静修”，地狱快笑出声。人类却因此困在堵车的长队里，从大理石拱门一直延伸到塔桥的。

你怀疑他只是走进了一家书店，然后忘了出来。

choices.label_en: Pull a replacement from the reserves (they won't be happy)
choices.label_zh: 从后备队抽调替补（他们不会高兴的）
choices.consequence_zh: 替补的天使带着明显的不情愿和一个文件夹到场了。九分钟内交通恢复。他在下班前提交了一份关于“恶劣工作环境”的投诉。
choices.consequence_en: The replacement angel arrived with visible reluctance and a clipboard. Traffic cleared in nine minutes. He filed a complaint about ‘hostile working conditions’ before his shift ended.

choices.label_en: Leak the story — chaos deserves a narrator
choices.label_zh: 把消息透露给记者——混乱值得被记录
choices.consequence_zh: 《伦敦标准晚报》的头条：“天使擅离职守——交通全面瘫痪。”评论区怪罪市长、移民和一只无辜的的鸽子。那位天使始终没被找到。
choices.consequence_en: The Evening Standard ran the headline: ‘ANGEL GOES AWOL.’ The comments blamed the mayor, immigrants, and one very specific pigeon. The angel was not found.

choices.label_en: Step in yourself and redirect three buses (you'll regret this)
choices.label_zh: 亲自上阵调度三条线路（你会后悔的）
choices.consequence_zh: 你重新调度了三条公交线路，和两个司机吵了架，差点被一个骑自行车的快递员撞到。天使在书店里被找到了，但他没有道歉。
choices.consequence_en: You redirected three bus routes, argued with two drivers, and nearly got hit by a bicycle courier. The angel was found in the bookshop. He did not apologise.

text_en:
Sirens scream along the Thames. Pigeons form unsettling geometric patterns over St. Paul's. An angelic spear — half-materialized, shimmering with cold light — appears embedded in the pavement at Piccadilly Circus.

Both sides are stepping closer to open war. The city air tastes of iron and ozone.

The cocoa on your desk has gone cold. You can't remember the last time it was warm.
text_zh:
泰晤士河畔警笛长鸣。鸽群在圣保罗大教堂上空排列出令人不安的几何图案。一柄半凝形态的天界长矛，闪着冷光，刺入皮卡迪利广场的路面。

双方正在逼近正面交锋，城市的空气尝起来有铁锈和臭氧的味道。

你桌上的可可凉了，你想不起来它最后一次是有温度是什么时候。

choices.label_en: Back the angels — someone needs to hold the line
choices.label_zh: 支持天使——总得有人守住防线
choices.consequence_zh: 长矛在黎明时消散。但鸽子们记住了那些几何图案，每天清晨它们仍在圣保罗大教堂上空描画
choices.consequence_en: The spear dissolved at dawn. But the pigeons remember the geometry, and they still trace it every morning over St. Paul’s.

choices.label_en: Forget the factions — get the civilians out first
choices.label_zh: 管他哪个阵营——先把平民撤出去
choices.consequence_zh: 三千名市民在一小时内撤离，没人被告知原因。沙夫茨伯里大道上一个女孩问你世界是不是要毁灭了，你说不是，这是你说过的最重要的谎言。
choices.consequence_en: Three thousand civilians evacuated in under an hour. No one was told why. A girl on Shaftesbury Avenue asked if the world was ending. You said no. It was the most important lie you ever told.

choices.label_en: Trigger the forbidden shortcut (you know the cost)
choices.label_zh: 启动禁忌捷径（你清楚代价）
choices.consequence_zh: 捷径生效了。代价是一段你的记忆，你再也想不起可可是什么味道了，你也不确定以前自己是否知道。
choices.consequence_en: The shortcut worked. The cost was a memory — yours. You can no longer remember what the cocoa tasted like. You’re not sure you ever could.

text_en:
No declaration of war was ever issued. And yet: scorched feathers on consecrated ground, claw marks on a church door in Mayfair, and laughter — low, familiar — echoing from the sewers beneath a certain flat in Mayfair.

All eyes turn to your archive. The only record no faction can edit.

Your pen hovers over the last page. There is a dry ring on the corner of your desk where a cup once stood.
text_zh:
没有人正式宣战。但圣地上散落着烧焦的羽毛，梅菲尔一座教堂门上有爪痕，某间梅菲尔公寓下方的下水道里回荡着低沉的笑声。

所有目光注视着你的档案——这是唯一无法被任何阵营篡改的记录。

你的笔悬在最后一页上方。办公桌角落有一个干涸的杯环印记，那里曾经放过一只杯子。

choices.label_en: Document the order — let Heaven's version stand as truth
choices.label_zh: 记录秩序——让天堂的版本成为唯一的真相
choices.consequence_zh: 天堂的版本现在被收录在地球上的每一座档案馆里。干净、完整、无人质疑。最后一页读起来像经文，感觉像一扇上了锁的门。
choices.consequence_en: Heaven’s version now stands in every archive on Earth. Clean. Complete. Unquestioned. The last page reads like scripture. It feels like a locked door.

choices.label_en: Document the fracture — let the cracks show through
choices.label_zh: 记录裂缝——让裂痕暴露在所有人面前
choices.consequence_zh: 裂缝暴露了，所有人都看得见。地狱欢欣雀跃，天堂怒不可遏，人类则第一次开始关注到这些，这种关注会变成理解还是恐慌，已经不由你决定。
choices.consequence_en: The cracks are visible now. Everyone can see them. Hell is delighted; Heaven is furious; humans are, for the first time, paying attention. Whether that attention becomes understanding or panic is no longer up to you.

choices.label_en: Seal the archive — some things are not for anyone to read
choices.label_zh: 封存一切——有些事不该被任何人读到
choices.consequence_zh: 档案被封存了，封蜡在你指腹下还是热的。某个很远的地方，你听到了一声也许是松了口气的叹息——又或许是一口屏住的呼吸。
choices.consequence_en: The archive is sealed. The wax is still warm under your thumb. Somewhere, very far away, you hear what might be a sigh of relief — or a held breath. You choose not to decide which.

text_en:
A minor miracle was reported in Camden. Three eyewitnesses offer completely different accounts: one swears flowers bloomed from concrete, another saw a column of white fire, and the third remembers nothing — only a feeling of being forgiven.

All three versions are affecting reality. Simultaneously.

You pick up your pen and realize: whichever version you write down will become the only one that ever happened.
text_zh:
卡姆登区上报了一起小型奇迹。三位目击者各执一词：一人发誓水泥中绽放了鲜花，一人看到白色火柱冲天，第三人什么都不记得。

三种版本正在同时影响现实。

你拿起笔突然想到：你写下哪个版本，哪个就会成为唯一发生过的事实。

choices.label_en: Archive all three — let reality sort itself out
choices.label_zh: 三个版本全部记录——让现实发生吧
choices.consequence_zh: 现实接受了全部三个版本，卡姆登区现在有了会燃烧的花朵。当地居民适应得出奇地好。房租涨了。
choices.consequence_en: Reality accepted all three versions. Camden now has flowers that burn. The locals have adjusted surprisingly well. Rents went up.

choices.label_en: Pick the flowers. Suppress the fire and the forgiveness.
choices.label_zh: 选择其中之一，需要唯一的真相。
choices.consequence_zh: 你选了花朵。火焰和失忆像无人记录的梦一样消散了。
choices.consequence_en: You chose the flowers. The fire and the forgiveness faded like dreams nobody wrote down.

choices.label_en: Declare all accounts invalid — punish them for seeing too much
choices.label_zh: 宣布所有证词无效——惩罚那些看到太多的人
choices.consequence_zh: 这场奇迹因无人记录而消失了——只在一面水泥墙上留下淡淡的茉莉花香。
choices.consequence_en: The miracle, unrecorded, simply unhappened — leaving only a faint smell of jasmine on a concrete wall.

text_en:
A mirror in a Selfridges display window has started whispering shoppers' ugliest private thoughts — then making them laugh uncontrollably. By noon, the queue stretches around the block.

One boy, no older than eleven, stood before it and heard his own reflection say: "I faked the miracle."

He hasn't stopped crying since. Nobody knows which miracle he means.
text_zh:
Selfridges橱窗里的一面镜子开始低声说出路人内心最恶毒的想法，然后让他们不可抑制地大笑。到了中午，排队的人已绕过街区。

一个不超过十一岁的男孩站在镜前，听见自己的倒影说：“那场奇迹，是我伪造的。”

他从那之后一直在哭，没有人知道他说的是哪场奇迹。

choices.label_en: Shatter it with a counter-miracle (fight absurdity with absurdity)
choices.label_zh: 用奇迹击碎这面镜子
choices.consequence_zh: 镜子碎成了恰好77片。每一块碎片仍在低语，但一次只对一个人说。
choices.consequence_en: The mirror shattered into 77 pieces. Each shard still whispers, but only to one person at a time.

choices.label_en: Leave it — study who comes, and what truths the mirror tells
choices.label_zh: 不动它——观察谁来了，镜子又说了什么真话
choices.consequence_zh: 到了傍晚，847人来看了镜子。你现在拥有有史以来最全面的人类忏悔调查档案。地狱想要一份副本，天堂想把它烧了。那个男孩来了两次。第二次，镜子什么都没说。
choices.consequence_en: By evening, 847 people had visited. You now own the most comprehensive survey of human guilt ever assembled. Hell wants a copy. Heaven wants it burned. The boy came back twice. The second time, the mirror said nothing.

choices.label_en: Move it to a children's play area (what could possibly go wrong?)
choices.label_zh: 搬去儿童游乐区（能出什么事呢？）
choices.consequence_zh: 儿童游乐区里的笑声持续了十一分钟。
choices.consequence_en: Children’s laughter filled the play area for eleven minutes.

text_en:
An angel and a demon have been meeting weekly at a café wedged between two defunct cemeteries, where ley lines overlap like crossed fingers. No miracles performed. No schemes hatched. Just espresso and shared silence.

Heaven has filed for tactical surveillance. Hell says, "We've been watching for years. It's unbearably domestic."

You have the footage. Both of them look... happy.
text_zh:
一位天使和一位恶魔每周都在两座废弃墓园之间的咖啡馆碰面，那里的聚集着许多魂灵。那里没有施展奇迹或者密谋，只有浓缩咖啡和共享的沉默。

天堂已申请战术监控。地狱说，“我们盯了好多年了。无聊得令人发指。”

你手里有监控录像。他们两个看起来……很开心。

choices.label_en: Leak the footage to both sides — let them burn together
choices.label_zh: 把录像匿名发给天堂和地狱的高层——让他们一起完蛋
choices.consequence_zh: 两个阵营在一小时内分别召回了各自的特工。命令传来时，天使和恶魔正坐在他们常坐的位子上。两人都没有动。浓缩咖啡凉了，咖啡馆当晚关门，再也没有重新开业。
choices.consequence_en: Both factions recalled their agents within the hour. The angel and the demon were sitting at their usual table when the orders came in. Neither moved. The espresso went cold. The café closed that evening and never reopened.

choices.label_en: Encrypt the footage, mark it as noise — protect what they have
choices.label_zh: 加密录像，标记为噪声——保护他们拥有的东西
choices.consequence_zh: 在所有重要的数据库里，录像现在显示“信号噪声——无内容”。天使和恶魔在下一个周四回来了。
choices.consequence_en: The footage now reads ‘SIGNAL NOISE — NO CONTENT’ in every database that matters. The angel and the demon returned the following Thursday.

choices.label_en: Walk in and deliver their coffee yourself
choices.label_zh: 走进去，亲手为他们送上咖啡
choices.consequence_zh: 你在他们桌上放了两杯咖啡。天使看了看恶魔，恶魔看了看你，没人说话。你在他们道谢之前离开了。走出门时，你觉得闻到了可可的味道，但这家店明明只卖浓缩咖啡。
choices.consequence_en: You set two cups on their table. The angel looked at the demon. The demon looked at you. Nobody spoke. You left before either could say thank you. On your way out, you thought you smelled cocoa — but the café only serves espresso.
